docs.snippet: Censored dispatches from Rio de Janeiro say Governor J. A. Flores da Cunha of Rio Grande do Sul has accepted the situation created by President Getulio Vargas's decree depriving him of authority to enforce martial law in his State, which virtually...
docs.lead_paragraph: Censored dispatches from Rio de Janeiro say Governor J. A. Flores da Cunha of Rio Grande do Sul has accepted the situation created by President Getulio Vargas's decree depriving him of authority to enforce martial law in his State, which virtually deprives him of governing power.
docs.abstract: Rept that Gov J A Flores da Cunha accepts Vargas's decree depriving him of authority to enforce martial law in his State; conflicting rept; civil war feared

headline.main: CIVIL WAR FEARED IN BRAZILIAN STATE; Rio Grande do Sul Governor Has 30,000 Militia to Meet Threat to His Power

docs.snippet: Brazil was cut off from communication with the outside world all day today by the strictest censorship since the 1930 revolt that overthrew President Washington Luiz du Albuquerque and put Dr. Getulio Vargas into power.
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil was cut off from communication with the outside world all day today by the strictest censorship since the 1930 revolt that overthrew President Washington Luiz du Albuquerque and put Dr. Getulio Vargas into power.
docs.abstract: Strictest censorship since 1930; country cut off from outside world

docs.snippet: All is not well in Brazil. The strictest censorship since the revolt of 1930, which brought GETULIO VARGAS to power, was imposed by him Thursday on all outgoing communications. No news of the real situation was allowed to filter even into Uruguay,...
docs.lead_paragraph: All is not well in Brazil. The strictest censorship since the revolt of 1930, which brought GETULIO VARGAS to power, was imposed by him Thursday on all outgoing communications. No news of the real situation was allowed to filter even into Uruguay, just across the southern border.
